title: [BUG] mlflow Docker creates all folders as root

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: y
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: 18.04 Docker
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.80
- **Python version**: 3.7
- **Exact command to reproduce**: Run any docker mlflow example

### Describe the problem
In my Docker container I am switching the user from root to a new user called 'user'. However, MLFlow creates all folders inside the Docker container as 'root'. Hence, I run into issues like:
```
GPU Run Time: 62.669366121292114 seconds
Logging model to mlflow...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mnist_pytorch.py", line 188, in <module>
    start_training()
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1066, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 610, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "mnist_pytorch.py", line 175, in start_training
    mlflow.pytorch.log_model(model, 'models')
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pytorch/__init__.py", line 158, in log_model
    registered_model_name=registered_model_name, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/models/__init__.py", line 102, in log
    mlflow.tracking.fluent.log_artifacts(local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 323, in log_artifacts
    MlflowClient().log_artifacts(run_id, local_dir, artifact_path)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 267, in log_artifacts
    self._tracking_client.log_artifacts(run_id, local_dir, artifact_path)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 268, in log_artifacts
    artifact_repo.log_artifacts(local_dir, artifact_path)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/local_artifact_repo.py", line 50, in log_artifacts
    mkdir(artifact_dir)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 110, in mkdir
    raise e
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 107, in mkdir
    os.makedirs(target)
  File "/home/user/miniconda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 223, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/home/zeth/PycharmProjects/mlflow_pytorch/mlruns/0/fb257ba0821147898df402a23ee214c1/artifacts/models'
```

And when running `ls -la`:
```
(pytorch) user@3aabccf058b8:/mlflow/projects/code/mlruns/0/fb257ba0821147898df402a23ee214c1$ ls -la
total 32
drwxr-xr-x 6 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 .
drwxrwxrwx 1 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 ..
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 artifacts
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root  396 Jan  1  1970 meta.yaml
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 metrics
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 params
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan  1  1970 tags
```
I can see that everything is owned by root. 
However, to my mind everything should be created and owned by the current user!

Is there a workaround for this? I already made a workaround for the models subdirectory, where I just run chmod -R 777 /mlflowruns , however, this does not work for the artifacts, since this whole directory is created at runtime at the single code line.

### Code to reproduce issue
Any Docker example should suffice. I can share my custom code if you need it, but it's getting complex now.
